title: In Memoriam: W. Richard Stevens
historical_context: This article serves as a tribute to W. Richard Stevens, a significant figure in the field of computer networking and programming, who passed away shortly before the publication of this issue.
target_audience: Hackers, security professionals, computer networking enthusiasts, and fans of W. Richard Stevens.
short_summary: This article pays tribute to W. Richard Stevens, a renowned author in the field of computer networking, highlighting his contributions and the impact he had on the community. It includes an obituary detailing his life and achievements.
summary:
In this heartfelt tribute, Phrack Magazine honors the legacy of W. Richard Stevens, a pivotal figure in computer networking literature. The article reflects on Stevens' profound influence through his works, particularly the 'UNIX Network Programming' and 'TCP/IP Illustrated' series, which have educated countless individuals in the intricacies of network programming and protocols. The author shares personal anecdotes about how Stevens' books inspired a generation of programmers and network engineers, emphasizing the loss felt by the community following his untimely death on September 1, 1999. 

The piece also includes a detailed obituary that outlines Stevens' life, from his early years in Zambia to his academic achievements and professional milestones. It highlights his contributions to the field, his passion for teaching, and his personal interests, painting a picture of a dedicated individual who left an indelible mark on the world of computing. The article serves not only as a remembrance of Stevens but also as a call to recognize the importance of mentorship and knowledge sharing in the tech community.
